resources.string: \nThis is a scrolling quiz. \nTo see the next question, just scroll!
What is the Capital city of Japan?
Not right! The answer is Tokyo!
During the Edo period, what was the Capital city of Japan?
Nice work. Kyoto was the capital during the Edo period. You\'ve got some basics down. How about a dive into the culture?
Unfortunately, this is incorrect. Kyoto was the capital city of Japan during the Edo period.
What is the name of the Japanese Raccoon Dog?
Great Job! In Japanese culture, a Tanuki is a shapeshifting Raccoon dog often depicted with gold nuggets, perhaps some Sake, and unusually large testicles.
Incorrect. Wasabi is a green paste used to help nullify the potential hazards of eating raw fish (Sushi).
Incorrect. Shinigami is the God of Death
Incorrect. A city known for blowfish. Poison fish, poison fish, tasty fish!
Which foods and drinks listed below are made with rice? \nCheck all that apply.
Yes, Japanese rice balls! Keep this one checked.
Ramen? Incorrect! Ramen is not generally made with rice. Generally. Uncheck this one.
Chashu? Incorrect! Chashu is a pork dish. Uncheck this one.
Tamago? Incorrect! Tamago is an egg. Uncheck this one.
Yes! Mochi is a rice dish! Keep this one checked.
Yes! Sake is a rice wine! Keep this one checked.
That\'s all of them! Sake, onigiri, and of course, mochi!
Which Japanese animal is notable for winter visits to spas?
Correct! The Japanese Macaque is also the northern-most living nonhuman primate, preferring colder climates that see snow a few months out of the year.
Incorrect. Like flying on land, the Shinkansen Express train can travel 150—200mph.
Go ahead and give it a guess!
Misogi is a Shinto purification ritual performed on the coldest day of the year.
Think about the raw nature of Shinto.
Incorrect! Participants purify their bodies by submersing themselves into cold water wearing next-to-nothing.
Correct! Participants purify their bodies by submersing themselves into cold water wearing next-to-nothing.
What is a polite thing to say when entering a Japanese household?
I am dirty and your house is clean. Please understand my dirtiness.
This house must be expensive! How fortunate you are!
I am polite. I am entering your house. Thank you for this invitation.
It is polite to say please excuse this disturbance when entering and leaving.
Thank you for playing the Japan quiz!
All artwork in this quiz was created by Katie Heckey on her trip to Japan.
